name: Broadwater Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You could not find more welcoming hosts than John and Doreen who own Broadwater B & B.
reviews.title: What a great place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a week in glorious weather at the start of February. Busselton is a delightful town on the coast with super beaches, shopping and opportunities to tour the SW area around Margaret River. Our hosts were so welcoming and knew just where we Poms should visit. John even took us to the golf course, as we hadn't seen any kangaroos...and there they were. Of course we saw them every day after that. As keen birdwatchers the area is very good with the Vasse catchment and varying coastal habitat nearby. There are not enough superlatives to describe our stay.
reviews.title: Home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Busselton for the Ironman WA competition, which involves weird hours, strange practices and odd eating requirements. But our lovely hosts, John and Doreen, talk absolutely everything in their stride. We had a big room with an ensuite, a double and a single bed, free broadband, TV and DVD - and best of all with a triathlete in the family, a kitchen for the use of guests. Doreen's breakfasts deserve to be legendary, and somehow just about every egg we had was a double yolk. The B&B is on the main road so there's a bit of traffic noise during the day but we weren't particularly disturbed - and it's very quiet at night. The other guest who was staying at the same time was from New Caledonia, and John switched from French to English and back again without blinking. It's a bit of a hike into town, so you'll need a car - but there's a lovely beach a couple of hundred metres down the road. We were made very welcome, and felt very much at home and very much looked after. We were tempted not to tell anyone else about it, in case they run out of room for us next time!
reviews.title: wonderful B&B , great stay

description: Our Bed and Breakfast provides clean and comfortable accommodation at an affordable rate. We provide a cooked breakfast, cereal, fruit, juice, toast and tea and coffee in the tariff. Each room has their own bathroom and TV/DVD in their rooms. Guests have their own lounge/dining room with TV/DVD/Foxtel and free WIFI. The kitchenette is well equipped with microwave, fridge, kettle, toaster etc. Busselton is located on the shores of beautiful Geographe Bay and hosts the famous Busselton Jetty and Train which takes visitors to the Underwater Observatory. We are the gateway to the Margaret River Wine Region. Other attractions are the caves, lighthouses, diving, snorkeling, fishing, surfing, golf, swimming, bush walking, galleries, wining and dining.
